question: Which country has the third-largest proven oil reserves in the world according to the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC)?
explanation: Iran has the third-largest proven oil reserves in the world according to the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC). Iran is a regional and middle power, with a geopolitically strategic location. Iran is a founding member of the UN, ECO, OIC, and OPEC. It has large reserves of fossil fuels â€” including the world's second-largest natural gas supply and the third-largest proven oil reserves.
